Pleasanton.Pleasanton Fairgrounds Racetrack: The Pleasanton Fairgrounds Racetrack at the Alameda County Fairgrounds in Pleasanton, California is a one-mile (1.6 km / 8 f) race track for Thoroughbred, Quarter horse and Arabian racing. Constructed in 1858 by the sons of Spaniard Don Agustin Bernal, it is the third oldest horse racing track of its kind in the United States. Only the Freehold Raceway (oldest) and Fair Grounds Race Course are older.
